explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_liquids.rationale: Flash point: >=23degC and <=60degC, UNRTDG Class: 3, PGIII

self_heating_substances.rationale: The test suitable for a liquid state substance has not been established. It is classified into the UNRTDG class 3.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing no oxygen, fluorine and chlorine.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: It was classified to category 5 based on the following lower value. Rat LD50 value: 4000mg/kg (ACGIH 7th, 2001, PATTY 4th, 1994, NTP TR 375, 1990) and 5700mg/kg (PATTY 4th, 1994).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on rat minimum lethal dose: 4500mg/kg (RTECS, 2005), it was set as the outside of Category.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Based on the description that death was not observed in the rat 8 hour inhale test of 2500ppm (4 hour equivalent: 17.05mg/kg, saturated vapor) IUCLID (2000), it is presumed to be either Category 4, Category 5, or out of Category. But it cannot be decided, and thus it cannot be classified.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: It was set as Category 2 from description that the skin of the humans was stimulated (NTP TR 375 (1990)), and from description that irritation was admitted by the test applied to the skin of the rabbit (IUCLID (2000), RTECS (2005)).

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: We classified it as Category 2A-2B based on the descriptions that it stimulates the human eyes (IARC 60 (1994), and ICSC (J) (1996)).

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: We found only one case in IARC 60 (1994) and other data could not be found and it did not bear the criteria, therefore we presupposed that we could not classify it for the insufficiency of data.

carcinogenicity.rationale: There is positive result (IARC 60, 1994, NTP TR 375, 1990) by the micronucleus test which uses the mouse red corpuscles , which are the in vivo mutagenicity tests using a somatic, there is no positive result by the in vivo genotoxicity study using a germ cell. So it is set as Category 2.

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Since it was classified into a group 3 in IARC (IARC 60, 1994) and A4 in ACGIH (7th, 2001), it was considered as the outside of Category.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause drowsiness or dizziness (respiratory tract irritation, narcotic effects) May cause respiratory irritation (respiratory tract irritation, narcotic effects)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: From description in ACGIH (7th, 2001), PATTY (4th, 1994), and NTP TR 375 (1990) that upper respiratory irritant was seen in human exposure, and from description in NTP TR 375 (1990) that the central nervous system depressions is seen by higher level of human exposure, it was set as Category 3 (respiratory irritation, anesthesia action).

aspiration_hazard.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
aspiration_hazard.classification: Category 1 (nervous system), Category 2 (liver, respiratory system, kidney)
aspiration_hazard.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (nervous system) May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (liver, respiratory system, kidney)
aspiration_hazard.rationale: We classified it as Category 1 (nervous systems) based on the description that the effect on the central nervous system was observed in human occupational exposure examples (IARC 60 (1994)). Moreover, based on the description that the effects on the liver and on the respiratory system were observed with the concentration a little exceeding the guidance value range of Category 2 in the 15-day inhalation exposure test using the rat (NTP TR 375 (1990)), and based on the descriptions that increased development of nephropathy was observed with concentration of the guidance value range of Category 2 in the 13-week inhalation exposure test using the rat (ACGIH (7th, 2001) and NTP TR 375 (1990)), we classified it as Category 2 (liver, respiratory organs, kidney).

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 3 from 96-hour LC50=23.4mg/L of fishes (Fathead minnows) (IUCLID, 2000).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Harmful to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classified into Category 3, since acute toxicity was Category 3 and supposed not rapidly degrading (BIOWIN), though less bio-accumulative (BCF=35 (IUCLID, 2000)).
